pot01.name: Pineapple Pair
pot01.notes: Two crowns rooting in big pot 1. Also holding three basil cuttings for now, for gifts if they root
pot01.whimsy: The Pineapple Twins opened a basil boarding house. Three Italian exchange students currently practicing dramatic sighs and rooting for tenure.

pot02.name: Rosemary Cutting Nursery
pot02.notes: Former 1a. These will become gifts if they root. Used rooting hormone powder when planted
pot02.whimsy: Elite finishing school for baby rosemary clones. Each student dusted with rooting-hormone fairy dust and dreaming of Christmas glory.

pot03.name: Celebrity Tomatoes
pot03.notes: Two plants ~1 ft tall, aluminum foil collars, 3" pine bark mulch. Currently winning at life.
pot03.whimsy: Twin red-carpet divas wearing tinfoil chokers and pine-bark ballgowns. Already demanding their own reality show.

pot04.name: Empty / Flex
pot04.whimsy: A polite void gently humming 'surprise me' in B-flat.

pot05.name: Passionflower Vine
pot05.whimsy: Five-star butterfly maternity ward & caterpillar spa. Tiny orange midwives expected any moment.

pot07.name: Lime Tree
pot07.notes: From Gary Kurz, received in May 2025
pot07.whimsy: Gary Kurz’s citrus heirloom, currently practicing its margarita monologue in a sultry baritone.

pot08.name: Mint
pot08.whimsy: Serving life in solitary confinement for repeated border violations. Still plotting a mojito-based coup.

pot09.name: Avocado Tree
pot09.notes: From Gary Kurz, received in May 2025
pot09.whimsy: Gary’s second gift. Torn between destiny as guacamole royalty or 40-foot shade monarch.

pot10.name: Parsley
pot10.notes: Intend to move to pot 7. From Gary Kurz, received in May 2025
pot10.whimsy: Parsley is packed and ready to relocate the moment pot07 stops hogging the good dirt.

pot11.name: Rosemary (temporary)
pot11.notes: Big pot 6 – will move to Pos 12 once drip line is fixed
pot11.whimsy: Rosemary is couch-surfing until pot23 finishes its drip-line trauma counseling.

pot12.name: French Marigolds
pot12.whimsy: Tiny French bouncers hired to keep the riff-raff away from the tomatoes.

pot13.name: Junk Pot – Future Parsley + Swamp Milkweed
pot13.notes: Big pot 7 – needs emptying and replanting
pot13.whimsy: The garden’s chaotic junk drawer: emo avocado teen, onion ghosts, and a pineapple wearing indoor sunglasses.

pot14.name: Basil
pot14.notes: Small pot 7a – will move to big pot 11
pot14.whimsy: Basil is waiting for its glow-up into the big leagues. Currently practicing pesto poses.

pot15.name: Dill + Marigold seeds
pot15.notes: Big pot 8 – will add bronze fennel later
pot15.whimsy: Seed kindergarten in session. Bronze fennel already RSVP’d fashionably late.

pot17.name: Cilantro + Marigold seeds
pot17.notes: Big pot 9 – will add jalapeño later
pot17.whimsy: Cilantro’s short, melodramatic life has begun. Jalapeño is circling the party with spicy intent.

pot22.name: Wandering Jew
pot22.whimsy: The bohemian aunt who leaves purple glitter trails and refuses to sit still.

pot23.name: Empty – future Rosemary + Italian Oregano
pot23.notes: Big pot 12 – waiting on drip line fix
pot23.whimsy: In intensive therapy after drip-line betrayal. Emotionally unavailable until further notice.

log.note: Standard feeding for actively growing pots
log.whimsy: Miracle Gro walked in like a rockstar and every leaf started head-banging. The glow is real.

log.note: Direct sown 5-8 seeds per pot, ¼" deep
log.whimsy: Sprinkled tiny orange confetti into five pots and whispered 'grow, my pretties' like a benevolent witch.

log.note: Skipped the three succulent royals because they’re on a diet
log.whimsy: Served ocean smoothies to everyone except the succulent royals who flipped their crowns and declared calories beneath them.

log.details: took cuttings from basil, parsley, and rosemary, planted rosemary (pot02) and basil (pot01), also put all three in water (vase) in kitchen
log.note: The cuttings that were added to pots 01 and 02 were dipped in rooting hormone
log.whimsy: Performed vegetative cloning under a waxing moon. The rosemary is already bragging about its future as a Christmas gift.

log.details: took close up of leaves to research damage
log.whimsy: Papparazzi’d the lime tree’s leaves because even celebrities get blemishes.

log.note: Everyone got a drink, even the drama queens
log.whimsy: After ten parched days the garden threw a collective sigh of relief so loud the neighbors thought it was raining.

log.note: Tomato Tower graduated to the 7-gallon palace
log.whimsy: The tomatoes threw a housewarming party the moment they moved into their new mansion. Invites were edible.
